bill.title: Regulatory boards.
bill.description: An act to amend Sections 27, 116, 125.9, 155, 159.5, 160, 726, 802.1, 803, 803.5, 803.6, 1005, and 2715 of, to amend and repeal Section 125.3 of, to add Sections 27.5, 125.4, 734, 735, 736, 737, 802.2, 803.7, 1006, 1007, 1699.2, 2372, 2815.6, 2669.2, 2770.18, 3534.12, 4375, and 4873.2 to, to add Article 10.1 (commencing with Section 720) and Article 16 (commencing with Section 880) to Chapter 1 of Division 2 of, and to repeal Article 4.7 (commencing with Section 1695) of Chapter 4 of, Article 15 (commencing with Section 2360) of Chapter 5 of, Article 5.5 (commencing with Section 2662) of Chapter 5.7 of, Article 3.1 (commencing with Section 2770) of Chapter 6 of, Article 6.5 (commencing with Section 3534) of Chapter 7.7 of, Article 21 (commencing with Section 4360) of Chapter 9 of, and Article 3.5 (commencing with Section 4860) of Chapter 11 of Division 2 of, the Business and Professions Code, to add Section 12529.8 to the Government Code, and to amend Section 830.3 of the Penal Code, relating to regulatory boards, and making an appropriation therefor.

history.action: Introduced. Read first time. To Com. on RLS. for assignment. To print.
From print. May be acted upon on or after March 20.
To Coms. on B., P. & E.D. and JUD.
From committee with author's amendments. Read second time. Amended. Re-referred to Com. on B., P. & E.D.
Set, first hearing. Testimony taken. Further hearing to be set.
Set for hearing April 22. (For vote only.) Set, second hearing. Failed passage in committee. (Ayes 1. Noes 1. Page 3294.)
Returned to Secretary of Senate pursuant to Joint Rule 62(a).

votes.desc: Do pass, but re-refer to the Committee on Judiciary.
